segments.text: What a mess in this kitchen, water everywhere from that stupid sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The faucet's still running, and no one's turned it off.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That woman is just polishing her plate, ignoring the flood.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her apron's probably getting soaked, and she doesn't care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Now the kids are stealing cookies like little thieves.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy on that ridiculous stool, it's going to break.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's got no business climbing up there without permission.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl egging him on, what are they thinking?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This disobedience is infuriating; someone needs to teach them better.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle's spreading, ruining the floor and everything.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Even the nice garden view can't make up for this chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't stand watching adults be so careless.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Turn around, lady, before the whole place is underwater!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: These kids are out of control.
segments.speaker: PAR
